casebody.data:
Argued and submitted November 20, affirmed as modified December 17, 1979 In the Matter of the Marriage of BLACK, Respondent, and BLACK, Appellant. (No. D7805 08269, CA 14392) 603 P2d 784 Kristena A. LaMar, Portland, argued the cause for appellant. With her on the brief was Lindsay, Nah-stoll, Hart, Neil & Weigler, Portland. Ira L. Gottlieb, Portland, argued the cause and filed the brief for respondent. Before Buttler, Presiding Judge, and Gillette and Roberts, Judges.

PER CURIAM

*695PER CURIAM

Pursuant to husband’s concession, the decree is modified as follows: (1) the last paragraph of paragraph numbered 4 of the decree, which requires wife to maintain life insurance on her life, is deleted; (2) subparagraph (d) of paragraph numbered 6 of the decree is modified to read as follows: "(d) The youngest living child of the parties shall have attained the age of 18 years.” In all other respects the decree is affirmed.

Affirmed as modified. Costs to appellant.
